item.title: Counting Word Frequencies in One Line
item.description:
cat book.txt | tr '!()[]{};:",<.>?“”‘’*/\r' ' ' | tr [:upper:] [:lower:] | tr ' ' '\n' | sed -e '/^$/d' | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr | cut -c9- | grep -a -P "^[\p{L}\p{N}\-']+\$" > words.txt
  • replace punctuations with space; remove \r from `\r\n’
  • convert to lower cases
  • one word per line
  • remove empty lines
  • sort and count unique words
  • sort by freqency in descending order
  • trim the frequency column
  • keep only words composed of unicode letters, numbers, hyphen and apostrophe

item.title: How to Remove All Exited Containers & Dangling Images for Docker?
item.description:
docker ps --quiet --filter=status=exited | xargs docker rm

docker images --no-trunc=true --filter="dangling=true" --quiet=true | xargs docker rmi

item.title: Tips on SSH
item.description:
Generate SSH keys

ssh-keygen -C w@h12.me

Authorize public key at remote server

ssh-copy-id user@host

On Mac OSX, ssh-copy-id should be installed first.

brew install ssh-copy-id

Generate PEM

ssh-keygen -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa -e -m pem > ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pem

Copy file by base64

On remote session, run base64 < myfile and copy the output.

On local terminal, run base64 -d > myfile, paste the content and press ctrl+D.

item.title: How to Disable the Touchpad in Linux?
item.description:
Have you ever been annoyed by accidentally touching the touchpad on your laptop when you are typing?

I am using a Linux laptop with both trackpoint and touchpad so the touchpad is just an annoying redundant thing. Here is the one-liner to disable it:

xinput list | grep TouchPad | grep -Po 'id=\K([0-9]+)' | xargs xinput disable
